info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 9:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Cumberland, Prince Edward, northwestern Lunenburg, northwestern Nottoway, northwestern Amelia and southwestern Powhatan Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sheppards to near Aspen. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Farmville around 915 PM EDT. Guinea Mills around 935 PM EDT. Cumberland around 950 PM EDT. Sunnyside, Tobaccoville, Morven and Ballsville around 1000 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Raines Tavern, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Angola, Briery, Arvins Store, Twin Lakes State Park, Hawk, Kingsville and Elam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
